128256942.review:
BATIM is one of the games I'm the most iffy on about my opinions. On one hand, I would say that I had a fairly good time with it. But on the other hand, some of the things you have to do in order to get any of the cool stuff is the hugest fucking hassle and there are way better games you could get for less than the asking price of this one. A lot of your time with this game(If you want to go %100 which if you don't the game is like 6 hours) will be playing through areas over and over again trying to activate easter eggs that are no where near worth you're time. I recently tried to go for the secret weapon in chapter 5 and have played through nearly all of chapter 1-3 at least 3 times now trying to get it. I'm not against cool easter eggs that are hard to get. But with this game the easter eggs aren't even hard to get. They're just tedious. And when a game asks the world from you, I believe you should expect the world from the game, and BATIM certainly does not do that. The game is littered with tons of annoying bugs(Especially with how saves work). Despite all these hiccups though, I do believe that there is a base here for a very good game. And it's recently released sequel, BATDR proves that. There also some really cool moments every now and then. If I had to review every chapter individually it would go like this(this is where I get into vague spoilers so watch out):

Chapter 1: 6/10, pretty cool for what it's worth. A neat tutorial to the basics of the game.

Chapter 2: 8/10, probably would've been my favorite chapter if it had some cool boss battles like in the other chapters.

Chapter 3:  7/10, when it's good it's really good. When it's bad it's really bad. Has some of the coolest easter eggs in the whole game. However, you will need a precise guide, multiple playthroughs of the chapter, and a shit ton of luck that the game doesn't break to find them all. Has two very cool boss fights.

Chapter 4: 9/10, my favorite chapter. Only gripes I have with it is that I don't believe it used the amusement park themed it goes for as well as it could've. You don't get to explore the remains of an amusement park, you get to explore a warehouse with shit from an amusement park. Also not all that many cool easter eggs.

Chapter 5: 7/10, pretty good. No big easter eggs besides like 1 and the bosses are a little underwhelming(but they're still kinda fun). It also had a really weird ending that only works if you plays its sequel that released years later. I think it was an effect of them trying to bite off way more than they could chew. They had way to many conflicts still hanging around for them to resolve in just one chapter. Feel like it would've been better if they just made the game a couple chapters longer since the ending was clearly not planned from the start anyway.

In conclusion, BATIM is pretty good game with quite a few issues. I'd say the game is best experienced with a couple of buds with a Saturday afternoon to kill while trying to find as much of the cool stuff as possible in the process. The big question you have to ask yourself with that is if it is worth the money for that. This game is $20 which is a very hard pill to swallow when you realize that the entire game series that this game is clearly inspired by(Bioshock) is $20 too and is way longer with an averaging length(without going %100) of about 12 hours(thanks howlongtobeat.com for the info!).

128200915.review:
Bendy and the Ink Machine is good, but not great. Usually when I see large youtuber's digging into a game en mass, I get pretty sceptical. Thankfully, Bendy is at least a unique and engaging experience, but one with plenty of flaws.

It has an incredibly unique style that works in the horror game space quite well. I can veritably say there's nothing out there which looks quite like this game in the horror genre.

The music is also quite good for the most part and fits the aesthetic well. My only problem with it would be that it can be often be incredibly overbearing and obnoxious during some of the more intense horror sequences. It can feel like the game doesn't have enough confidence in the scares themselves and is instead trying to drown them out with symphony.

Gameplay wise, its your typical indie horror dish with more of a focus on light puzzles and fetch quests. You can definitely see when playing that the devs didn't want Bendy to be a walking sim, so they tried hard to include a lot of variety from chapter to chapter. While they do succeed in providing this variety, the mechanics themselves aren't always fleshed out. There is actually combat in Bendy, but it involves nothing more than just spamming your left mouse button on repeat, there's no finer mechanics here, just hit the enemies until they die. The puzzles themselves aren't really puzzles at all, its just getting items from one location and moving them to another to open up the next door on repeat. The longest a single puzzle ever took me was probably 5 minutes give or take, and I absolutely suck at puzzle games.

As for the horror part, like I said when referring to the music, Bendy lacks confidence. Most of the enemy designs with the exception of Bendy himself aren't all that intimidating. The game also loves to use jumpscares without buildup to try and scare you, which is really lame. Not to mention it does the FEAR 2 tactic of blasting the visuals with ugly filters during key moments to create a feeling of intensity when it didn't need to. The final boss is also really disappointing, dying doesn't really have much of a consequence and there's nothing in the way of challenge.

The primary thing that'll keep you going in Bendy is the mystery of the plot itself. Without spoiling anything, its a lot like Bioshock 1 or Amnesia: A Machine For Pigs in the way it focuses on the risks of ambition and man being consumed by his own creation. It was a great concept in those games and it works very well here too. The characters are also well built and interesting on top of this.

Overall, its a fair indie horror experience with an intriguing world, story and characters. The gameplay flaws do bring it down a tad, but they're very fixable and I'm interested in playing the sequel to see how it improves upon this game.

When all's said and done, its only just over 4 hours long and doesn't require much out of you. If you're just looking for a short, unique narrative experience, I'd say get it on a sale.

An OK experience but highly overrated.
This game got its good moments, a decent atmosphere and exploration. But - 

1. The action mechanic there is absolutely boring. It is very simplistic, which wasn't problem if it was fun, but instead it's very clunky and repetitive.
2. Some specific enemies are nicely designed, but the most common are boring. I understand they suppose to be moving puddles of ink, but yet.
3. As I said the exploration is good, but it is more accurate to say "most of it", since a specific level in the game is a total tedious repetitive sequence of going back and forth while fetching item.

Overall, it is an experience worth trying, but perhaps wait for a discount.

128076745.review:
El juego tiene sus momentos terrorificos, aunque yo creo que se basa más en el suspenso y en un sentimiento constante de sentirte acechado lo cual cumple bastante bien, el juego tiene una atmosfera oscura y desolada con un toque parecido a dibujos animados y le da un toque especial, aunque por Dios hay veces que te mandan muchos objetivos y a buscar cosas (por ejemplo el Cap 3) y se siente bastante cansado, la música es bastante buena y se apega a las situaciones no es el mejor soundtrack pero si se sabe complementar correctamente con el juego, es bastante corto de hecho diria que es muy corto pero esta bien, no es un juego que debería durar demasiado, se puede completar en 3 o 5 horas, pero, yo personalmente lo complete en 9 horas porque hay veces que salia y por alguna razón no se me guardaban las partidas lo cual me hacia repetir desde el cap 1 o porque cierto objeto que tenia a buscar no aparecia por lo que me tocaba salir y guardar (pero paso lo anteriormente mencionado) a pesar de esto yo diria que el juego es bastante bueno, tiene su estilo propio con su ambientación única y un lore bastante bueno de hecho, es disfrutable y te puede sacarte un o varios sustos, lo recomiendo.

Gracias y Feliz día
